modules.description: This module implements low-level byte transport over Xenstore Unix domain sockets using Lwt for asynchronous I/O. It provides functions to create and destroy socket channels, read from and write to sockets, and includes Lwt bind and return operations for composing asynchronous actions. Concrete use cases include communicating with Xenstore in virtualization management tools, where precise control over socket I/O is required.

This module implements a client for interacting with the Xenstore service, providing functions to manage a hierarchical key-value store. It supports operations like reading, writing, and removing keys; creating and traversing directories; setting permissions; and handling watches and transactions. It is used for communication between virtual machines and the hypervisor in Xen-based systems.

This module implements low-level communication over a Xenstore Unix domain socket, providing functions to create and destroy socket channels, read from and write to sockets with explicit byte buffers and offsets. It works directly with Unix file descriptors and byte buffers, supporting operations specific to Xenstore protocol messaging. It is used to implement clients that interact with the Xenstore service in Unix domain configurations.

This module manages access to Xenstore sockets, providing operations to retrieve available Xenstore paths and select a valid path for communication. It works with string lists and optional strings to handle path discovery and selection. Concrete use cases include initializing connections to Xenstore in virtualization management tools or monitoring services.
